titles.title: Fantasista Doll
ファンタジスタドール
Fantasista Doll
Fantasista Doll

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch50512 [Uno Uzume], a girl who is an elite player at card tournaments, is one day given a curious device which uses special cards to summon artificially intelligent female warriors known as Fantasista Dolls. From this day on, Uzume spends each day spending time with her new friends, while also fighting battles against other card masters who seek to have their wishes granted in exchange for defeating her. Source: Wiki

externalentity.identifier: ファンタジスタドール

tag.name: summoning
tag.description: Ability to call/materialize some kind of creature.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: magical girl
tag.description: Magical girls (also known both in Japan and in the West as mahou shoujo, and in Japan as majokko) are young girls with superhuman abilities of magical nature. In the early years, magical girls usually used magic to solve everyday problems and often transformed into idols; nowadays, however, the term is most often used to refer to with girls who fight evil using magical powers, and, although transformations are still common, they tend to be more along the lines of a change of costume.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: master-servant relationship
tag.description: To some genres, this would suggest a genuine pairing where one person exists to serve another person, such as in some action/dramas where the pair becomes united by destiny as partners — fighting or battles between different pairs/partners will usually be a dominant part of the story. In other genres, this suggests a relationship where one person may be occupied as or even forcefully treated as a servant or slave to the other who designates themself the master — these services usually apply anywhere from tsundere/romantic-comedies to ecchi or to the more extreme in hentai.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: じめじめしめじ 残念王子の逆襲?
Jimejime Shimeji: Counterattack by the Pathetic Prince?
Jimejime Shimeji: Zannen Ouji no Gyakushuu?
episode.summary: Although she does not remember him well, Shimeji knows her previous master was kind and sweet, but for some reason she was abandoned by him. Uzume brings Shimeji out on the town to cheer her up after noticing she`s kind of down. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さくっと作戦 マドレーヌの献身?
The Expedient Errand: Madeleine`s Devotion?
Sakutto Sakusen: Madeleine no Kenshin?
episode.summary: Madeleine tries to take care of her wonderful master, but Uzume starts to get annoyed by Madeleine`s persistence. Sasara talks to Uzume about it and decides to to keep Madeleine from leaving the cards. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ささらさらさら 仮にもマイマスター?
Sasara Sara Sara: You`re My "Master"?
Sasara Sarasara: Kari ni mo My Master?
episode.summary: Uzume Uno, a new card master, trains with her five dolls, girls that appear from cards, called Fantasista Dolls. Uzume starts to have trouble, and wants to return the cards to their previous owners. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うずめうずうず 忍び寄る怪しい影?
Uzume Uzu Uzu: A Shadow Draws Near?
Uzume Uzuuzu: Shinobiyoru Ayashii Kage?
episode.summary: Uzume is an ordinary middle school girl with one unusual trait: she`s a master at card games. But when someone slips a strange device in her bag on the train, suddenly the game turns real! Now she`ll have to use her Fantasista Doll, a life-sized female doll that says it will grant her every desire, to fight off the people who will do anything to get the device back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
玉ねぎたまたま 文化の祭り?
Onion On On: A Fair of Culture?
Tamanegi Tamatama: Bunka no Matsuri?
episode.summary: Uzume and the others set up a curry shop with the Card club. Uzume is very busy because she also has to deal with her Tennis club and class projects. But a girl wearing a china dress shows up targeting Uzume after receiving instructions from the mysterious Foundation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 心ころころ? あわせてひとつ
A Heart Tart? All Together As One
Kokoro Korokoro? Awasete Hitotsu
episode.summary: Uzume receives a special team card from Lord Rafflesia. In order to use the power contained within the card, the hearts of Uzume and her dolls must be completely in sync. However, this proved to be much more difficult than expected, and instead unrest grows between them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小明かりかり 拘束と献身?
Akari Kari Kari: Restrictions and Devotion?
Akari Karikari: Kousoku to Kenshin?
episode.summary: Uzume meets a young girl into Gothic clothing named Miina, and for some reason she calls her dolls her masters. Minna had hoped to become a doll herself, after being impressed at the loyalty displayed by the dolls. Akari finds herself having to choose between Minna and Uzume. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばたばたバイト はじめてのカティア?
Work Work Working: Katia`s Beginning?
Batabata Beit: Hajimete no Katia?
episode.summary: Uzume joins her friend`s card club, but the person who tried to take her cards, Totori Kagami is there. Meanwhile, the dolls start to work part-time jobs as they cannot have Uzume buy them snacks since she`s run out of allowance... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 希望うきうき みんなきらきら
Wishes Upbeat, Everyone`s Shining
Kibou Ukiuki: Minna Kirakira
episode.summary: The battle between the Chairman and Uzume starts, almost like it was unavoidable from the beginning. Just who will get their wish? Uzume holds her cards up high, with strong emotions in her heart. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小町まちまち? 約束の献身
Komachi Machi Machi? Promised Devotion
Komachi Machimachi? Yakusoku no Kenshin
episode.summary: The Chairman shows herself to Uzume. Uzume learns what the Chairman is really after, and decides to talk it over with the rest of the Card Club. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ぽかーんとポーカー 委員会の挑戦?
Poked Poker: The Director`s Challenge?
Pokaan to Poker: Iinkai no Chousen?
episode.summary: Madeleine`s card was stolen, and Uzume and her dolls fall into a slump. Anne, the right-hand man for the Chariman, challenges Uzume to a certain fight. They are to fight with cards over Madeleine. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かがみかみかみ? まぎれる気持ち
Kagami Kami Kami? Confusing Feelings
Kagami Kamikami? Magireru Kimochi
episode.summary: Kagami decided to keep trying to take Uzume`s cards to grant her own wish, but notices that she`s no longer sure whether or not she wants to fight Uzume. Then Kagami suddenly gets a text... Source: crunchyroll
